meanings.definition: To fasten or secure something in place again with tacks.
meanings.sent1: She retacked the loose poster on the wall to keep it from falling.
meanings.sent2: He retacked the carpet edge to prevent tripping hazards.
meanings.sent3: The cat retacked the toy mouse to the floor, claiming it as her own.
meanings.sent4: The idea retacked itself in his mind, refusing to be forgotten.
meanings.sent5: The retacked sign fluttered in the wind, announcing the upcoming sale.
